GeneralInformation.School Vision: Greendale Primary School will beAn excellent community of learners anchored in values
GeneralInformation.School Mission: Our mission is To nurture each child holistically through excellence in teaching and learning.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: Every child matters in Greendale Primary School.   Our teachers are committed to deliver a curriculum to suit the needs of our pupils. We believe in the holistic development of our pupils and promote the development of 21st century competencies so that our pupils will be future-ready. We cultivate positive attitudes towards learning and focus on the teaching of thinking skills which are essential for life-long learning in order for them to navigate in an increasingly complex world.  Another important aspect is the teaching of social emotional competencies as key to developing soft skills in our pupils so that they can work with others collaboratively in an increasingly interconnected environment. Undergirding these efforts is a commitment towards ethical growth through character building and an emphasis in values education.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.Interdisciplinary: Developing Critical and Inventive Thinking Skills through Toy Design
School Distinctive Programmes.Sports & Outdoor Education: Developing 21st Century Lifelong Learners through Outdoor Education

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: Toy Story is one of the school's distinctive programmes.  It aims to develop pupils' critical and inventive thinking skills through toy design.  Our pupils are taught thinking skills such as Edward de Bono's 6 Thinking Hats and are encouraged to ask questions as they gather information to help them in their tasks.  The process of questioning and clarification leads to the discovery of science concepts and reinforces their learning from the Science syllabus.  They will also reflect and work on improvements to their toys based on peer and teacher reviews.  Our pupils have the opportunity to contribute in consensus building and group decisions and build their confidence in small group settings.    With the aim of developing future-ready individuals, the school has also introduced a distinctive programme that focuses on outdoor education.  The programme caters for both mass level participation from Primary 1 to Primary 6 and development of selected pupils who demonstrate stronger interest and ability in outdoor activities.  By taking learning beyond the classrooms, our pupils acquire relevant life skills and learn to appreciate and care for the environment.  They also become more adaptable and confident through their active participation in various age-appropriate outdoor activities such as sports climbing, hiking and adventure camps.    Co-curricular Activities (CCAs), learning journeys and values-in-action activities play significant roles in the holistic development of our pupils.  At Primary 1 and 2, every pupil participates in programmes such as drama, visual arts and dance.  For Primary 3 to 6 pupils, we offer over 20 CCAs such as chess, uniformed groups, guitar and international dance.  Our pupils develop their character and leadership through active CCA involvement.
